intro: Rechsteineria cooperi, commonly known as the Cooper's rechsteineria, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and botanical research.
